1.text: And Zophar the Naamathite answered and said,

2.text: Therefore do my thoughts give me an answer, and for this is my haste within me.

3.text: I hear a reproof putting me to shame; and [my] spirit answereth me by mine understanding.

4.text: Knowest thou [not] this, that of old, since man was placed upon earth,

5.text: The exultation of the wicked is short, and the joy of the ungodly man but for a moment?

6.text: Though his height mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds,

7.text: Like his own dung doth he perish for ever; they which have seen him shall say, Where is he?

8.text: He flieth away as a dream, and is not found; and is chased away as a vision of the night.

9.text: The eye which saw him shall [see him] not again; and his place beholdeth him no more.

10.text: His children shall seek the favour of the poor, and his hands restore his wealth.

11.text: His bones were full of his youthful strength; but it shall lie down with him in the dust.

12.text: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth [and] he hide it under his tongue,

13.text: [Though] he spare it, and forsake it not, but keep it within his mouth,

14.text: His food is turned in his bowels; it is the gall of asps within him.

15.text: He hath swallowed down riches, but he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.

16.text: He shall suck the poison of asps; the viperâ€™s tongue shall kill him.

17.text: He shall not see streams, rivers, brooks of honey and butter.

18.text: That which he laboured for shall he restore, and not swallow down; its restitution shall be according to the value, and he shall not rejoice [therein].

19.text: For he hath oppressed, hath forsaken the poor; he hath violently taken away a house that he did not build.

20.text: Because he knew no rest in his craving, he shall save nought of what he most desired.

21.text: Nothing escaped his greediness; therefore his prosperity shall not endure.

22.text: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits; every hand of the wretched shall come upon him.

23.text: It shall be that, to fill his belly, he will cast his fierce anger upon him, and will rain it upon him into his flesh.

24.text: If he have fled from the iron weapon, the bow of brass shall strike him through.

25.text: He draweth it forth; it cometh out of his body, and the glittering point out of his gall: terrors are upon him.

26.text: All darkness is laid up for his treasures: a fire not blown shall devour him; it shall feed upon what is left in his tent.

27.text: The heavens shall reveal his iniquity, and the earth shall rise up against him.

28.text: The increase of his house shall depart, flowing away in the day of his anger.

29.text: This is the portion of the wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed to him by God.
